sections.context:
STANDARDIZATION ORGANIZATION FOR G.C.C (GSO)
GSO 1040/2000
MOTOR VEHICLES -
ALLOW ABLE LIMITS OF POLLUTANTS EMITTED TO
THE ATMOSPHERE FROM LIGHT DUTY DIESEL
ENGINED VEHICLES
ICS: 13.040
MOTOR VEHICLES -
ALLOW ABLE LIMITS OF POLLUTANTS EMITTED TO
THE ATMOSPHERE FROM LIGHT DUTY DIESEL
ENGINED VEHICLES
Date of GSO Board of Directors' Approval 11- 6- 1421 (9-9-2000)
ISSUING STATUS STANDARD
MOTOR VEHICLES -
ALLOWABLE LIMITS OF POLLUTANTS EMITTED TO
THE ATMOSPHERE FROM LIGHT DUTY DIESEL
ENGINED VEHICLESThis standard is concerned with the allowable limits  of gaseous pollutants and
smoke emitted to the atmosphere from new light duty vehicles with maximum
weight equal to or less than 3500 kg powered by diesel engines.

chapters.raw_text:
This standard is concerned with the allowable limits  of gaseous pollutants and
smoke emitted to the atmosphere from new light duty vehicles with maximum
weight equal to or less than 3500 kg powered by diesel engines.

children.chapter_title: Gaseous pollutants: Substances airborne to atmosphere, which arise during the
children.raw_text:
running of the vehicle, due to exhaust gases.  They include carbon monoxide,
hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.1 Gaseous pollutants: Substances airborne to atmosphere, which arise during the

children.chapter_title: Exhaust gases: Gases produced  by  combustion  of  the fuel, emitted to the
children.raw_text: atmosphere at any point downstream of the exhaust ports of the engine.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.2 Exhaust gases: Gases produced  by  combustion  of  the fuel, emitted to the

children.chapter_title: Smoke: Particulate matter  in  the exhaust emissions which obscures the
children.raw_text: transmission of light.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.3 Smoke: Particulate matter  in  the exhaust emissions which obscures the

children.chapter_title: Light duty vehicles: Any motor vehicle having a maximum weight equal to or less
children.raw_text: than 3500 kg.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.4 Light duty vehicles: Any motor vehicle having a maximum weight equal to or less

children.chapter_title: Maximum weight:  The kerb weight together with the maximum load declared by
children.raw_text: the manufacturer.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.5 Maximum weight:  The kerb weight together with the maximum load declared by

children.chapter_title: Kerb weight: The  weight  of the vehicle with standard equipment, maximum
children.raw_text:
capacity of engine fuel, oil and coolant, the spare wheel, tools and, (if so
equipped), the air conditioning system.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.6 Kerb weight: The  weight  of the vehicle with standard equipment, maximum

children.chapter_title: Reference weight of vehicle (rw): The kerb weight+ 100 kg.
children.full_path: 3- DEFINITIONS/3.7 Reference weight of vehicle (rw): The kerb weight+ 100 kg.

children.chapter_title: The mass of gaseous pollutants in the exhaust gases shall not exceed the amounts
children.raw_text:
given in Table (1) when testing the vehicle in accordance with Gulf Standard No.
1041/2000 "Motor Vehicles - Methods  of Testing for Pollutants Emitted from
Diesel Engined Vehicles - Part 1:  Determination of Exhaust Gaseous Pollutants".

children.full_path: 4- REQUIREMENTS/4.1 The mass of gaseous pollutants in the exhaust gases shall not exceed the amounts

children.chapter_title: The  light absorption coefficient  of  the exhaust gases shall not exceed the
children.raw_text:
respective limits for k specified in Table (2) when testing the vehicle/engine, in
accordance with Gulf Standard No. GSO 1042/2000 "Motor Vehicles - Methods of
Testing for Pollutants Emitted from Diesel Engined Vehicles - Part 2:
Determination of Smoke". In case of engines equipped with an exhaust driven
supercharger, the absorption coefficient measured under free acceleration shall not
exceed the respective limit for k, specified in Table (2), plus 0.5 m-1,  for the
nominal flow value  corresponding to the maximum absorption coefficient
measured during the test at steady speeds.

children.chapter_title: There shall be no emission from the crankcase of the vehicle to the atmosphere.
children.full_path: 4- REQUIREMENTS/4.3 There shall be no emission from the crankcase of the vehicle to the atmosphere.

chapters.raw_text:
The manufacturer shall supply with each vehicle, a booklet, in English, or Arabic
or both, including instructions for the maintenance of the vehicle in relation to the
control of emissions, within the limits specified in this standard.

7.1 The criteria of technical conformity shall be in accordance with the requirements
specified  in  Gulf Standard No. GSO 48/1984 "Motor Vehicles - Conformity
Certificates".

children.raw_text:
7.2.l The vehicle shall be considered complying with the requirement specified in item
4.1of this standard, if the measured mass of carbon monoxide and the combined
mass of hydrocarbon and oxides of nitrogen, are less than or  equal to 0.70 of the
allowahle limits mentioned in Tahle (1 ).

children.chapter_title: The test shall  be repeated  if in the initial test, the measured masses of both the
children.raw_text:
carbon monoxide and the combined value of hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen
are less than or equal to 0.85 of their allowable limits and one of these values is
greater than 0.70 of its allowable limit.
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.2 Vehicle subjected to type test/7.2.2 The test shall  be repeated  if in the initial test, the measured masses of both the

children.chapter_title: The vehicle shall be considered complying with the requirement mentioned in item
children.raw_text:
4.1of this standard if the measured masses of both the carbon monoxide and the
combined value hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen in the second test, is less
than its allowable limit and if the sum of the masses of both the carbon monoxide
and the combined value of hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen in the two tests is
less than 1.70 of the allowable limit.
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.2 Vehicle subjected to type test/7.2.3 The vehicle shall be considered complying with the requirement mentioned in item

children.chapter_title: The test shall be carried out a third time  if the sum of the masses  of both the
children.raw_text:
carbon monoxide and the combined value of hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen
in the two previous test is greater than 1.70 of the allowable limit or the measured
mass of both the carbon monoxide and the combined value of hydrocarbons and
oxides of nitrogen in either of those tests, is equal to or greater than the allowable
li1nit and not more than 1.1 tilnes the allowable li1nit.
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.2 Vehicle subjected to type test/7.2.4 The test shall be carried out a third time  if the sum of the masses  of both the

children.chapter_title: The vehicle shall be considered complying with the requirement mentioned in item
children.raw_text:
4.1of this standard,  if the arithmetic means  of the masses  of both the carbon
monoxide and the combined value of hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen in the
three tests is less than or equal to allowable limit and not more than one of the
masses for each pollutant ( carbon monoxide and the combined mass  of
hydrocarbons and oxides  of nitrogen) in the three tests exceeds 1.1 times the
allo able limit
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.2 Vehicle subjected to type test/7.2.5 The vehicle shall be considered complying with the requirement mentioned in item

children.chapter_title: The vehicle shall be considered non-complying with the requirement mentioned in
children.raw_text:
item 4.1  if more than one of the measured masses of both the carbon monoxide
and the combined value of hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen in the three tests
exceed 1.1 times the allowable limit for the pollutant.
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.2 Vehicle subjected to type test/7.2.6 The vehicle shall be considered non-complying with the requirement mentioned in
7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.2 Vehicle subjected to type test

children.raw_text:
item 5.4 in the case  of  acceptance  of  the certificate accompanying the
consignment.
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.3 Vehicles subjected to acceptance tests/7.3.1 The consignment shall be accepted without carrying out the tests mentioned in

children.chapter_title: If the certificate is not accepted or whenever otherwise deemed necessary, tests
children.raw_text:
mentioned in item 5.4 shall be carried out on the sample vehicle taken as in item
5.2.
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.3 Vehicles subjected to acceptance tests/7.3.2 If the certificate is not accepted or whenever otherwise deemed necessary, tests

children.chapter_title: The  vehicle taken is subjected  to  the test under free acceleration and  if the
children.raw_text:
absorption coefficient determined does not exceed by more than 0.5 m- 1  to the
limits specified in Table (2), then the vehicle shall be considered complying with
the requirement specified in item 4.2 of this standard.  If exceed the vehicle is
subjected  to  the test at full load steady speed.  The vehicle shall  be considered
complying with the requirement specified  in item 4.2 of this standard,  if the
absorption coefficient determined is less than or equal to the limits specified in
Table (3).
children.full_path: 7- CRITERIA OF TECHNICAL CONFORMITY/7.3 Vehicles subjected to acceptance tests/7.3.3 The  vehicle taken is subjected  to  the test under free acceleration and  if the

children.chapter_title: Should the first sample fail the test the manufacturer may ask for measurement to
children.raw_text:
be performed on a sample of vehicles taken from the consignment and including
the vehicle originally taken.  The manufacturer shall determine the size (n) of the
sample. Vehicles other than the vehicle originally taken shall be subjected to a test
specified in (5.3.1).  The arithmetical mean m  of the results obtained with the
sample shall then be determined for both the carbon monoxide and the combined
value of hydrocarbons and oxides of nitrogen.  The consignment shall then be
deemed to conform if the following condition is met:
m + k.S <L
Where:
L is the limit value laid down  in Table  (1)  for the e1nissions  of carbon
monoxide and the combined emissions  of hydrocarbons and oxides  of
nitrogen.
S is the value obtained from the following equation:
s2 =  L cm - ~)2
n - 1
m is any one of the individual results obtained with the sample n, and
k is a statistical factor depending on (n) and given in the Table (3).
